text.__SUMMARY__: Begonia aconitifolia is a species of plant in the family Begoniaceae, endemic to Brazil. It grows up to 1 meter in height, with panicles of pink flowers.
text.Synonyms:
Begonia faureana Garnier
Begonia faureana var. argentea Linden
Begonia faureana var. metallica Rodigas
Begonia kimusiana C.Chev.
Begonia sceptrum Rodigas
text.References:
Ann. Sci. Nat., Bot. IV, 11: 127 1859.
The Plant List
Hortipedia
The Garden Geeks
